message.content:
<<<api>>>: ArrayList.remove
<<<code>>>: for (Iterator<TopEnemy> iterator = newTopEnemy.iterator(); iterator.hasNext();) {
    TopEnemy i = iterator.next();
    for (int q = 0; q < ammo.length; q++) {
        float xsubs = i.enemyX - ammo[q].positionX;
        float ysubs = i.enemyY - ammo[q].positionY;
        float squared = (xsubs * xsubs) + (ysubs * ysubs);
        float distance = (float)Math.sqrt(squared);
        if (distance < 10.0) {
            iterator.remove();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: When removing elements from an ArrayList while iterating over it, you should use the Iterator's remove() method instead of the ArrayList's remove() method. This ensures that the iteration is not affected and the elements are properly removed.
